snippet: A tall fence that for decades has physically and symbolically separated Hamden from mostly black, poor New Haven projects is being partly dismantled.
abstract: Dismantling of barrier fence that separates public housing project in New Haven from middle-class neighborhood of adjacent Hamden, Conn, is stirring racial tensions; built in 1950s by Hamden to keep out crime, fence has fostered resentment among largely black and poor residents of public housing, but its removal is agitating mostly white Hamden residents who fear spike in criminal mischief.
lead_paragraph: A tall fence that for decades has physically and symbolically separated Hamden from mostly black, poor New Haven projects is being partly dismantled.

headline.main: In Connecticut, Breaking a Barrier Between a Suburb and Public Housing
headline.print_headline: Barrier Between a Suburb and Public Housing Falls
